page.title: 08Pollution:Water & Lorries
page.content: At Langford the reservoir takes{35 {Million }Gallons of water from the Chelmer and Blackwater rivers: The water is used locally but also pumped to the big reservoir at Hanningfield 12 miles to the south.This year the chemists at Langford have been testing the water for nitrates - used by farmers as a fertiliser - because the heavy rain has washed them into the rivers.They say that the levels of Nitrates are a little higher but well below any danger level. The other pollution comes from lorries.The local gravel pits have supplied much to the building of the Chelmsford By-Pass and the M.25 : Local residents in Woodham Walter and Langford complain of the noise of these Lorries going through their villages.
